thread.title: Wednesday’s $301M Powerball jackpot close to a record
thread.title_full: Wednesday’s $301M Powerball jackpot close to a record | www.ajc.com

author: Steve Visser
title: Wednesday’s $301M Powerball jackpot close to a record
text:
Wednesday’s Powerball jackpot isn’t a record but it is darn close — at least for this year.
The $301 million jackpot is the second largest in 2015, and it can only go higher.
So far, since Aug.5, the jackpot has rolled 16 times. If it comes to a screeching halt Wednesday, the big winner (s) will have the option of having the mega-pot paid over 29 years in 30 payments or taking a $191 million lump sum.
Powerball tickets cost $2 each.
The last winner on Aug. 1 was a ticket sold in California, which brought a $110 million jackpot, according to the Georgia Lottery.
The No. 1 winner was May 18 2013 when a Florida player won a $590.5 million pot, according to lottery officials.
